ancient times.

column3:
聞こえてくる話から想像するに
ネド王子の性根は悪くなさそうだ
友好的な関係を築いてくれよ
column4:
From the stories I hear, it seems that Prince
Nedo is not a bad person at heart. He has built
friendly relationships.

column3:
自分に言い聞かせようとしているが
なかなか――な
column4:
I'm trying to tell myself that
but it's not easy to--

column3: 落ち着け――落ち着くのだ
column4: Calm down――You need to calm down.

column3:
見たところセシリーは、無垢な心を持った
乙女という風情だが――
column4:
From the looks of it, Cecily has the air of a
maiden with an innocent heart...

column3:
覚者に力を与えたぶんだけ
白竜自身の回復が遅れる――
そう考えることもできる
column4:
For the Arisen, the more power they are given,
the slower The White Dragon's recovery becomes— It
can be thought of that way.

column3:
覚者のことは覚者に任せるしかない
よく見ていてやるんだぞ
column4:
We have to let the Arisen take care of the
Arisen. You're going to have to watch them very
closely.

column3:
覚者の本分は白竜の回復を助けることだ
――ゆめゆめ忘れるなよ
column4:
The Arisen's true duty is to aid in the recovery
of The White Dragon. - Never, ever forget that.

column3:
覚者よ、頼んだぞ
おまえたちの働きが大勢を決める
column4:
Arisen, I'm counting on you. Your work will
determine the outcome for many.

column3:
覚者を育てるのは、結局のところ経験だ
いや、これは覚者に限らないがな
column4:
The cultivation of an Arisen ultimately comes
down to experience. No, this applies not only to
Arisens.

column3:
解放軍が勢い付いたことで
アッカーシェランの混乱はますます
拡大するだろう
column4:
With the recent momentum gained by the People's
Liberation Army, the chaos in Acre Selund is
expected to further escalate.

column3:
解決の方法も、何かあるのかもしれない
うまく聞きだして、手助けしてやりなさい
column4:
I will do everything I can. At the very least, I
will support you with my prayers.

column3:
言うまでもないことだろうが――
城の奪回はそう簡単なことではないだろう
column4:
I guess it goes without saying--
Taking back the castle won't be so easy.

column3: 誇り高き孤独な魂――
column4: Proud, lonely souls--

column3:
賛成しかねるが――
無為なことと断じるつもりもない
column4:
I cannot agree, but I have no intention of
calling it meaningless.

column3:
近々、ある調査団を派遣することになってな
その人選で、いささか多忙だ
column4:
I'm sending a survey team soon and I'm somewhat
busy with the selection process.

column3:
頼むぞ
レオとおまえの間にどんな絆が――
あるいは確執があるのかは知らんが
今はセシリーを助けることを最優先してくれ
column4:
If we defeat the leader of the Corruption demons,
the power of the Corruption should dissipate.

column3:
首尾はどうだ？
朗報を待っているぞ
column4: How'd it go? I'm waiting for good news.

column3:
騎士団と覚者が力を合わせて戦えば
勝てぬ相手などおらん――
column4:
When the knight order and the Arisen join forces
and fight together, There is no opponent we cannot
defeat.

column3:
いいのか――
俺たち覚者はこのままでいいのだろうか――
column4:
Is this okay――
Are we, the Arisen, fine as we are――

column3:
おまえは感じたことはないか？
自分の真ん中を貫く、熱いモノ――
それが揺らぎ、壊れてしまう不安を
column4:
Have you ever felt it?
The intense thing that pierces through your core -
The uncertainty that wavers and breaks.

column3: この仕打ちは――なんだ――
column4: What is this strike- what is it?

column3:
ご苦労だったな
とりあえず今は何もない
column4:
You went through a lot of trouble.
For now, there is nothing.

column3:
その男がアークを送り込み――
ズールを使ってオークを取りまとめ――
イリスの正気とキースヒルトの命を奪った――
column4:
The man sent the Ark--
using Zuhl to gather the Orcs--
and took away Iris's sanity and Kieshildt's life--

column3: どうした、深刻な顔だな
column4: What's wrong? You look serious.

column3: どうした。俺には遠慮は無用だ
column4: What's wrong? No need to hesitate with me.

column3: どこにいる――今すぐにでも倒してやる！
column4: Where are they - I'll take them down right now!

column3: やるべきことをやろう――お互いにな
column4: Let's do what we have to do--for each other.

column3:
よし、今後、あの子のことは
おまえに任せるとしよう
column4:
All right,
I'll leave her in your hands from now on.

column3: アークの話は知っているか？
column4: Do you know the story of the Ark?

column3:
イリスのことは俺にまかせてくれ
長い付き合いだ
column4:
I'll take care of Iris.
We've known each other a long time.

column3:
イリスの件で動いてくれたそうだな
俺からも礼をいう
世話になった
column4:
I've heard that you took action regarding the
matter concerning Iris.
I also want to say thank you.
I appreciate your assistance.

column3: キースヒルトの死はけして無駄ではない
column4: The death of Kieshildt is by no means in vain.

column3:
ジョゼフが最善を尽くそうとしていることは
わかっているが――さすがに焦れるな
column4:
I understand that Joseph is doing his best, but-
understandably- he gets impatient.

column3: ディアマンテス――
column4: Diamantes--

column3: メイリーフがなついているようだな
column4: Looks like you've got a soft spot for Mayleaf.

column3:
メイリーフも普通の娘ではないから
そう簡単に敵の手に落ちたりはしないだろう
column4:
Mayleaf is not an ordinary girl, so she wouldn't
easily fall into the hands of enemies.

column3: 休むか遊ぶか――好きにしてくれ
column4: Rest or play――do as you please.

column3: 体は常に鍛えておけよ
column4: You've got to keep your body in shape.

column3:
何者だ、ディアマンテス――
いや、聞いたことはある
レスタニアを繁栄の世界から戦場に変えた
張本人――
column4:
Who are you, Diamantes--
No, I've heard of you before.
You're the one who turned Lestania from a
prosperous world into a battlefield,
The mastermind--

column3:
多少無理をしてでもメイリーフを
連れ戻して欲しかったが――
まあ、今はそのキースヒルトを信じるしか
ないようだな
column4:
No matter how unreasonable it may be, I wanted
you to bring Mayleaf back...
Well, it seems like now I have no choice but to
believe in Kieshildt.

column3:
彼女の信頼を裏切るような者がいれば
話は別だが――
column4:
If there is someone who betrays her trust, it's a
different story...

column3:
忘れるな
俺たちは覚者――使命に生き、使命に死す者だ
column4:
Do not forget
We are the Arisen - those who live and die for
the mission.

column3:
悪いな
茶飲み話なら、後にしてくれ
column4:
Sorry
If it's just casual conversation, please save it
for later.

column3:
探究心を忘れず、常に新しいものに触れろ
覚者の人生は長い
退屈すると――つらいぞ
column4:
Explore without forgetting your heart and always
touch something new.
The life of an Arisen is long.
It is painful to be bored.

column3:
敵の会話に登場したエルフとは
間違いなくキースヒルトのことだ
狙われているとあれば放ってはおけない
column4:
Whoever the elf mentioned in the enemy's
conversation is, it's definitely Kieshildt. If
they're being targeted, I can't just leave them
alone.

column3:
時間を作って、なるべく歩きまわれ
神殿をくまなく見て回るのもいいし
遠出してみるのもいいだろう
column4:
Make time to walk around as much as possible.
You can look all over the temple or
go far away!

column3:
気を抜くなよ
絶対に安全な場所なんてのは無いからな
column4:
Don't let your guard down.
There is no such thing as an absolutely safe
place.

column3:
派遣した調査団が調べているのだろうが
早く正体を知りたいものだな
column4:
I wonder what the dispatched investigation team
is examining.
I really want to know their true identity soon.

column3:
白竜に命が捧げられる限り――
誰の命も無駄にはならない
column4:
As long as a life is dedicated to the White
Dragon--
No one's life will be wasted.

column3:
白竜の力――
少しでも多く継承できれば――
column4:
The power of the White Dragon - If even a little
can be inherited -

column3:
腐れモゴックめ――
ただですむと思うなよ
column4:
Mogok, you rotten scoundrel――
Don't think you'll get off easy.

column3:
腕試しに一戦やるか？
おっと、そんな顔するな――冗談さ
column4:
You want to try your hand at a fight?
Oops, don't give me that look--I'm kidding.

column3:
衣食の面倒までは見切れないから
自分でなんとかしてくれ
column4:
I can't take care of your food and clothing, so
you're on your own.

column3:
覚者であることには慣れたか？
道は――見えたか？
column4:
Have you become accustomed to being an Arisen?
Did the path become visible?

column3:
覚者として生きることに
見返りを求めたことはなかったが
column4:
As an Arisen, I have never sought anything in
return for living this way.

column3:
覚者として生きるということは
白竜と世界の行く末を見届ける――ということだ
column4:
To live as an Arisen means to witness the fate of
The White Dragon and the world.

column3: 覚者ひまなし――いつものことだ
column4: There is no free time for an arisen――as always.

column3:
言っておくが、俺が面倒を見てやれるのは
おまえが行くべき場所――
戦うべき相手の指示だけだ
column4:
Let me make it clear, the only thing I can do for
you is
to give you directions on where you should go -
only instructions on who you should engage in
battle with.

column3:
話せば――わかるさ
ああ――きっとわかる
column4:
Talk to him--you'll understand.
Yeah--you'll understand.

column3: ――あんた目付き、レオに似てきたね
column4: You have a similar expression to Leo, huh.

column3:
ああ、忙しい――
誰かさんの人使いが荒いのか
わたしの要領が悪いのか――
column4:
Oh, I'm so busy--
Either someone's not being very helpful...
Or maybe I'm just not very good at what I do.

column3:
あんたが頑張ってくれるとわたしがちょっと
楽になるからね！
column4:
If you work hard, I'll be a little
relieved!

column3:
あんたなかなかやるよね
これでわたし、楽できるかも？
column4:
You're quite good, aren't you?
Maybe this will make things easier for me.

column3:
いい奴だから、覚えておきなよ
ファビオね、ファビオ
column4:
He's a good guy, so remember him.
Fabio, right, Fabio.

column3:
さあ、どうするの？
覚者なら、迷いなんてないでしょ？
column4:
Well, what are you going to do?
If you are Arisen, you shouldn't have any doubts,
right?

column3:
さっそくご活躍だね！
うん、いいよぉ
column4:
You're doing great already!
Yeah, sure!

column3: そういえば、ファビオって覚者とは会った？
column4: By the way, have you met Fabio, the Arisen?

column3: なに？　なになに？
column4: What?　What, what, what?

column3:
わからないんだよね
何が正しくて、何が間違ってるのか――
column4:
I don't know, you know.
What is right and what is wrong -

column3: わくわくするね
column4: I'm excited, aren't you?

column3:
わたしには力がある
だから、それを使うのは当然――うん、当然
column4:
I have the power
So, it's only natural to use it - yes, naturally!

column3:
何？
わたしの顔に、何かついてる？
column4:
What?
Do I have something on my face?

column3:
手伝ってあげられなくてごめんよ
わたしはわたしで忙しくてさ
column4:
I'm sorry I can't help you.
I'm busy with my own things.

column3:
敵を倒して、魔物を狩って――
もっと強くなれば別の生き方が見えるのかな
column4:
Defeat the enemies and hunt the monsters――
If I become stronger, will I be able to see a
different way of living?

column3:
楽しい時間って、限られてるから
価値あるんだよね
column4: Fun times are limited, so it's worth it.

column3:
結局さ、どうなるかわかんないよね
世界なんてさ
column4:
In the end, you never know what will happen, you
know?
The world and all that.

column3:
自信持っていいんじゃない？
あんたなら、できそうな気がする
column4:
You should have confidence.
I think you can do it.

column3: 難しい顔しちゃって――悩みでもあるの？
column4: You look so concerned - what's troubling you?

column3:
くれぐれも己の力に溺れるなよ
どんな戦士も、過信という泥沼には
簡単に足を取られる
column4:
Please do not indulge in your own power. Any
warrior can easily get trapped in the quagmire of
overconfidence.

column3: ふん――ひまそうだな
column4: Hmm, it looks like you have some free time, huh?

column3: ほう？　我々騎士団に何用だ
column4: What?　What do you want with us Knights?

column3:
グリッテン砦のヴァネッサ殿が
来ているようだが――
騎士団は蚊帳の外か？
column4:
It seems that Lady Vanessa of Fort Gritten is
coming--
Is the knights order out of the loop?

column3:
人智を超えた敵であろうと、我らは戦わねばならない
それが騎士というものだ
column4:
We must fight even against enemies beyond human
understanding.
That's what knighthood is all about!

column3:
時間があるのなら
外の魔物でも倒してきたらどうだ
column4:
If you have time, why don't you go and defeat
some monsters outside?

column3:
死を覚悟し、同時に生を諦めないこと
それが戦場で生きのびる秘訣だ
column4:
Be prepared to die and not give up on life at the
same time.
That's the secret to survival on the battlefield.
To face death and at the same time not give up on
life,
That is the secret to surviving on the
battlefield.

column3:
礼節を忘れるな
この《謁見の間》では特にな
column4:
Do not forget the etiquette
In this 《Audience Chamber》, especially

column3:
規律なくして人は動かぬ
例外は――ない
column4:
Without discipline, people will not work.
There are no exceptions.

column3:
覚者といえども軍規には従ってもらう
仲間の命を守るためだ
column4:
Even though they are Arisen, they must obey
military regulations. It is to protect the lives
of their comrades.

column3:
覚者とは、常に責務を負う者
白竜に、地に、人に――
すべてに仕える者だということを忘れるな
column4:
The Arisen is someone who always bears
responsibility.
To the White Dragon, to the land, to the people—
never forget that they serve everyone.

column3:
覚者は勝手な連中が多いが――
貴殿は悪習に染まるなよ
column4:
Arisen often tend to be a bunch of troublemakers,
but...
Don't let yourself be tainted by bad habits.

column3:
重要な話か？
違うなら後にしてくれ
column4:
Is it an important conversation?
If not, please postpone it.

column3:
騎士団の犠牲は竜の力となることで
報われる――ああ、そうとも
column4:
The sacrifice of the knights will be rewarded
with the power of the dragon - oh, indeed.

column3:
グリッテンの守備隊を増強している
覚者は基本的に遊軍として参加可能だ
column4:
We are augmenting the garrison of Gritten.
Arisen can join guerrilla force.

column3: 砦周辺の敵がいつでも貴殿を待っているぞ
column4:
The enemies around the fortress are always
waiting for you.

column3:
白竜様の言葉――
ひと言も聴き逃すわけにはいかんな
column4:
The world you see and the world I see might be
different.

column3:
貴殿はイリスと親しかったようだが――
覚悟しておいた方が良さそうだ
column4:
It seems that you were close with Iris, but it's
better to be prepared.

column3:
白竜の敵とあれば厳しい結論が
下るだろうからな
column4:
Because if you're an enemy of The White Dragon,
you're going to come to some harsh conclusions.

column3:
イリスは騎士団の中でも人気のある覚者だ
もし討伐ということになれば――
column4:
Iris is a popular Arisen among the Order of
Knights. If it comes to a subjugation...

column3: いや、考えたくもない
column4: No, I don't even want to think about it.

column3:
――面目ない
巫女殿を連れ去られるとは――
column4: Unthinkable — to have the Priestess taken away...

column3:
くそっ――レオめ――
手加減するとは無礼な――
column4:
Damn it ―― Leo ――
It is rude to hold back ――

column3:
騎士たる者はやはり戦場に立たねばな
メルゴダで会おうではないか
column4:
A knight must indeed stand on the battlefield.
Let us meet in Mergoda.

column3: さあ、ともに戦おうではないか！
column4: Well, let's fight together, shall we?

column3:
ディアマンテスを退けたからといって
すべての問題が解決するわけではないだろう
しかし今は――
column4:
However, just because we have defeated Diamantes,
it does not mean that all problems will be
resolved.
However, for now...

column3: ああ、感慨無量とはこのことだな
column4: Ah, this is what "overwhelmed with emotion" means.

column3:
立場上不謹慎な発言かもしれんが
世のこういう状況はけして嫌いではないのだ
貴殿なら、わかるだろう？
column4:
It may be inappropriate for me to say this from
my standpoint, but I don't dislike this kind of
situation in the world. You know what I mean,
don't you?

column3:
戦場で貴殿の顔を見ると
ああ、負けはないな、と思うのだ
column4:
When I see your face on the battlefield,
Ah, I think there is no defeat.

column3:
長いこと、覚者などイケ好かない連中だと
思っていたが、この変わりよう――
自分のことながら、笑うわ
column4:
For a long time, I thought that people like
Arisen were not good, but this change... even I
have to laugh.

column3:
セシリーやレオのことが気にかかるだろうが
それならなおのこと侵食魔退治に
邁進しようではないか
column4:
You might be concerned about Cecily and Leo,
But if that's the case, we should strive even
more to exterminate the corruption and infected.

column3: 結局はそれが近道になるだろうよ
column4: In the end, that will probably be the shortcut.

column3:
レスタニア中のブラッドオーブを
根こそぎここに集めるぞ！
column4:
I will gather all the Blood Orbs in Lestania,
from every corner!

column3:
他に火急の任がないのであれば
貴殿も力を貸してくれ
column4:
If you have no other pressing duties,
you can help.

column3:
騎士団の士気は高いが、それでどうにか
なるわけでもなし――
何か他の道はないのか！
column4:
The morale of the knight order is high, but that
alone doesn't lead to anything—Isn't there any
other way?

column3: ミシアルの姿が見えたらしいな
column4: I hear you got a glimpse of Mysial.

column3:
死してなおレスタニアを思う気持ちが
うれしいではないか
column4:
I'm glad you're still thinking of Lestania even
in death.

column3:
貴殿はまるで竜を救うために
生まれてきたようだな
いやいや、深い意味はない
column4:
It seems as though you were born to save dragons.
No, no, there is no deeper meaning.

column3:
有用な情報は――
いまのところ、無い
column4: There is no useful information at the moment.

column3:
誰もかれもが仲良くやれるなんて
そんな都合のいい話はない
column4:
No one can get along with everyone. It's not that
convenient.

column3:
真の平和、正しき統治――
その足掛かりはどこにある――
column4:
True peace, just governance-- Where is that
foothold--?

column3: 忙しいんだ、後にしてくれ
column4: I'm busy, do it later.

column3:
いつでも力は貸す
だが、慣れ合うつもりはないぞ、覚者
column4:
I will lend you my strength, but I have no
intention of getting too familiar, Arisen.

column3:
我が騎士団の力、侮るな
覚者だけが、白竜の盾ではない
column4:
Do not underestimate the power of our Order.
Arisen are not the only shields of the White
Dragon.

column3: 竜に選ばれし者の活躍――見せてもらうぞ
column4: Let's see what the dragon's chosen one can do.

column3:
明け暮れる戦いの日々――
その先に平穏はあるのだろうか
column4:
Days of endless battles -- Is there tranquility
beyond them?

column3:
何が起ころうと動じない心
それだけは、覚者にもひけをとらん
column4:
An unwavering heart no matter what happens, that
is something even the Arisen cannot match.

column3:
身を挺し、人々と竜を守る――
その覚悟こそが白衛騎士団の矜持だ
column4:
Risking your life, protecting people and dragons.
That determination is the pride of the White
Knights.

column3:
ゲルト騎士団長が留守がちだから
忙しくてかなわんよ
column4:
Gerd, the leader of the Knight Order, is often
absent. I am too busy to keep up.

column3: 本当なら、そばで学びたいことがたくさんあるのだが
column4:
There are many things that I need to discuss with
the prince. I can't afford to rest just yet.

column3: はっ！　って、なんだ、あんたか
column4: Huh! What, it's you?

column3:
おお――顔は覚えたぞ
俺は騎士団の副長ハインツだ
今後も色々あるだろうが――よろしくな
column4:
Oh—I remember your face. I am Vice Captain Heinz
of the Knight Order. There will be various things
happening in the future, but—please take care of
me.

column3:
調査団と出かけた護衛隊の中には
俺の部下もいるんだ
もしあんたも行くなら、よろしく頼む
column4:
Among the escort squad that went with the survey
team, There are also my subordinates. If you're
going too, I'll count on you.

column3:
アークから戻らなかった部下がいるのだ
やりきれんな――
column4:
There are subordinates who did not return from
the Ark. I can't stand it—

column3:
あんたはなかなか見所があると
騎士団長から聞いている
あらためて、よろしくな
column4:
You have quite a presence, as I've heard from the
Knight Commander. Once again, I look forward to
working with you.

column3:
どうした？
顔に余裕があるな
ひと仕事終えたという感じだ
column4:
What's up? You've got a look on your face like
you've done your job.

column3:
どうも騒がしいが――
大きな命令が下りそうな気配だな
column4:
Apparently there's a lot of noise-- Looks like
we're about to get a big order.

column3:
いや、グリッテンの戦いは盛り上がったな
ついつい思い出してしまうよ
column4:
No, the battle of Gritten was exciting. I can't
help but reminisce about it.

column3:
犠牲は大きかったが――
けして無駄にはならない
俺はそう信じている
column4:
Sacrifices were made, but they were not in vain.
I believe that.

column3:
騎士団は欠員が補充されて
ほっとひと息だ
column4:
The Knights have filled the vacancy. It's a
relief.

column3:
そういえば最近あの子を見ないな
いつも元気な女の覚者だ
column4:
By the way, I haven't seen that girl recently.
She's always been an energetic Arisen.

column3:
そう、イリス――
騎士団の中でも人気があるんだ
column4: Yes, Iris is popular even among the knights.

column3:
ここのところオークもおとなしいな
ずっとこうだといいのだが――
column4:
The orcs have been quiet as of late, too. I wish
it could be like this all the time—

column3:
なんとか街を守り切ったが――
こんなに攻め込まれるとは前代未聞だ
column4:
Somehow we managed to protect the town, but it's
unheard of to be invaded like this.

column3:
戦況は一進一退という認識は
間違いのようだな
column4:
The perception that the war is going back and
forth seems to be wrong.

column3:
厳しい顔のレオを見たが――
何を始める気だ？
column4:
I saw Leo with a stern look on his face-- What
are you trying to start?

column3: これは見逃せないと思ってね――
column4:
I think this is something you can't miss, you
know...

column3:
近頃、騎士団に参加したい――
騎士になりたいという者が増えている
column4:
Recently, more and more people want to join the
Order—want to become knights.

column3:
頼もしいことのように思えるが
皆、危機を身近に感じているということでもある
いったい、これからどうなるんだろうな
column4:
It seems like a reliable thing to do, but it also
means that everyone is feeling the crisis close at
hand. I wonder what in the world is going to
happen now?

column3:
ミシアル様がひさしぶりに大階段を下りたと
うわさになっているぞ
column4:
Rumor has it that Mysial has descended the grand
staircase for the first time in a long time.

column3:
第二のアークにイリスが現れたってのは
本当なのか？
いったい何をしていたんだ？
column4:
Is it true that Iris appeared in the second Ark?
What on earth was she doing?

column3:
アークの破壊部隊が編成されるはずだから
わたしは志願するつもりだ
column4:
Since the Ark's destruction squad is supposed to
be formed, I'm going to volunteer.

column3:
うわさになっている覚者の討伐には
参加したくないからな
column4:
I don't want to participate in the rumored
subjugation of the Arisen.

column3:
わたしたちを責めたければ責めるがいい
しかし、街にほとんど被害はなかった
それは騎士団の奮闘によるものだ
column4:
You are free to blame us.
However, there was little damage to the city,
thanks to the efforts of the Knight Order.

column3:
巫女が連れ去られるのを黙って見ていた
わけではないんだ
column4:
I didn't just silently watch as the woman was
abducted.

column3:
ミシアルが自ら闇に身を投げ――
誘拐犯たるイリスはレオが討伐した
そのレオは神殿に戻っていない――
column4:
Mysial threw herself into darkness— Iris, the
kidnapper, was defeated by Leo. But Leo has not
returned to the temple—

column3:
ジョゼフとクラウスの意見は対立し――
白竜は相変わらずまどろみの中――
column4:
Joseph and Klaus have conflicting opinions - The
White Dragon remains in a deep slumber.

column3:
なあ、おれたちはこのままでいいのか？
どこで何をすればいいんだ？
column4:
Hey, are we okay just like this? Where should we
go, and what should we do?

column3:
騎士団長はレオが手を抜いたと主張している
ということは――
column4:
The leader of the knights claims that Leo slacked
off which means—

column3: はて、どういうことだ？
column4: Well, what is this all about?

column3:
レオとは戦いたくない
たとえ手加減されても俺は逃げる
column4:
I don't want to fight Leo. Even if he takes it
easy on me I'll run.

column3:
その代わり、見かけた魔物は片っ端から
切り捨ててやる
column4:
Arisen, I will cut down every monster I see in my
way.

column3:
最前線は譲ってやる
感謝するんだな
column4:
I'll give you the front line. You should be
thankful.

column3:
これまで幾つもの戦いがあったが――
騎士団と覚者がこれほど協力し合って
事にあたったことはなかったんじゃないかな
column4:
There have been many battles so far, but the
Knights and the Arisen cooperating like this, I
don't think it has ever happened before.

column3:
今この時、ここにいられることが
誇らしくてたまらないよ
column4: I'm so proud to be here at this moment.

column3:
ゲルト騎士団長と仲間たちを
よろしく頼んだぞ
column4:
I entrusted Gerd, the leader of the Knight Order,
and his comrades to you.

column3:
正直言って、覚者の中にあんたがいるのは
助かるよ
column4:
To be honest, it's reassuring that you're one of
the Arisen.

column3:
レオは嫌いじゃないけど、なんだか
やりにくくてさ
column4:
I don't dislike Leo, but somehow he's difficult
to work with.

column3: 最早、話すことなどない
column4: There is nothing to say anymore.

column3:
相互理解など凡夫の夢――
愚かなことよ
column4:
Mutual understanding is an ordinary man's dream—
It's foolishness.

column3:
悔はない
いまは決意あるのみ
column4:
No regrets.
Now we just have to be determined.

column3: 動き始めたものは、止められない
column4:
Once something starts moving, it cannot be
stopped.

column3: これ以上、互いに何を得るというのだ
column4: What more do we have to gain from each other?

column3:
覚者――
いびつな存在だ
column4: Arisen - what a depressing existence.

column3:
錬金の術をもってしても時は戻せない
ならば――
過去を悔やむ時間など無駄だ
column4:
Even with the art of alchemy, time cannot be
reversed. If that is the case―― Regretting the
past is a waste of time.

column3:
戦うのであれば――
死を覚悟したまえ
column4:
If you fight--
be prepared to die.

column3:
ここを、全ての古きものの終の地としよう
そして新たに、世界を描き変えるのだ
column4:
Let this be the end of all that is old and let us
redraw the world anew!

column3:
同意など求めぬ
ただ受け入れたまえ、この浄化を
column4:
I don't ask for your consent. Just accept this
cleansing.

column3: ほう？　話したいというわけか
column4: Oh? So you want to talk, is that it?

column3:
おや――少々意外ではあるな
錬金を忌む世で育った君が
《アルケミスト》に興味を持つとはね
column4:
Well--it's somewhat surprising that you, who grew
up in a world that abhors alchemy, would be
interested in becoming an Alchemist.

column3:
正直に言って、興味本位は困る
これからのわたしの立場もあるからね
column4:
To be honest, I'm troubled by curiosity for
curiosity's sake. Because it also involves my
future position, you know.

column3:
加えて、思い違いをしてもらっては
やはり困るが――
column4:
In addition, if you could misunderstand, that
would still be troublesome...

column3:
いやいや、すまない
どうも警戒が先に立ってしまってね
column4:
No, no, I'm sorry. I was just being cautious,
that's all.

column3:
君なら問題ないだろう
課題さえ乗り越えてくれれば
喜んで指導させてもらうよ
column4:
If it's you, there should be no problem. As long
as you can overcome the challenges, I would be
happy to guide you.

column3:
ほほう――課題を乗り越えたのか
君は白竜がかつて封じた錬金術を
覚者でありながら、学ぼうというんだね
column4:
Oh, I see—have you overcome the challenge? You,
as an Arisen, wish to learn the alchemy that the
White Dragon once sealed away.

column3:
嬉しくもあり、危うくもあり――
だが君が選んだのなら
私はその選択を尊重するよ
column4:
With the same purpose, traveling with fellow
comrades and walking together. Well, isn't it
wonderful?

column3: では、《アルケミスト》として共に歩もう
column4: Well then, let's walk together as 'Alchemists.'

column3:
錬金術とはそもそも、人の論理を用い
人の為に導く学問
理との共存も、君ならできるかもしれないね
column4:
Alchemy is, in the first place, the study of
using human logic to guide people. You might be
able to coexist with reason, too.

column3:
なかなかどうして、覚えが早いな、君は
もう中等レベルの錬金術は十分に
使いこなせているようだね
column4:
You're quite remarkable, your ability to learn
quickly. It seems like you're already proficient
in intermediate level alchemy.

column3:
ならば、もう少し上級の技に手を出して
みてもいいかもしれない
こういう技だが、どうだい、やれそうかな？
column4:
In that case, you might consider delving into
more advanced techniques. How about this
technique? Do you think you can handle it?

column3:
ううむ、末恐ろしいな、君は
この短期間でこれほどまでに成長するとは
わたし、ディアマンテスでさえ――
――いや、やめておこう
column4:
Hmm, it's quite frightening how much you've grown
in such a short period of time. Even I, Diamantes-
No, let's not go there.

column3:
いいかね、錬金術は論理の結晶
自然なるものに、人為的に別の特性を
組み合わせ変化させる術だ
column4:
Listen, alchemy is the crystallization of logic.
It is the art of combining and transforming the
natural with artificial characteristics.

column3:
君の意思、君が紡いだ論理こそが
技の要となる、それを常に思い出し
これからの技に向きあいなさい
column4:
Your will, the logic you weave is the key to
technique.
Always remember that and face the future of your
art.

column3:
錬金術の中には、術の論理を戦いの技
として応用したものがある
自身の生命力を媒介に、物質を生成・変換し
組み変える技だ
column4:
Wow, you stink. You certainly smell the part,
Arisen, but it couldn't hurt to take a bath every
now and then.

column3:
《アルケミスト》として君が錬金術を学ぶ
なら、そちらの分野がいいだろう
column4: As an "alchemist", you should study alchemy.

column3:
溶命炉の力を見たのなら知っているとおり
命のエネルギーは人も魔も惹きつける
――あれに比べればもちろん、規模こそ小さいがね
column4:
If you have seen the power of the Furnace, as you
know,
the energy of life attracts both humans and
demons.
Of course, compared to that, it is small in
scale, but you know.

column3:
力の流れと理論を知り、意思によって自在に
操ることができれば、君が生成するエネルギーは
エリクシルと交わることで
敵を蝕む毒にも、友を守る薬にも変わるだろう
column4:
If you know the flow and theory of power, and can
manipulate it at will, the energy you generate
will intersect with the elixir and turn into a
poison that will weaken your enemies or a medicine
that will protect your friends.

column3:
錬金術を扱う上で、もっとも大切なことは
やはり、錬成物質とエリクシルの変換だろう
column4:
When dealing with alchemy, the most important
thing remains the transformation of alchemized
substances and elixirs.

column3:
エリクシルとは属性の性質そのもの
錬成物質はエリクシルと結合し発動
することで、様々な効果を帯びる
column4:
Elixirs are substances that combine with the
attributes themselves and activate, giving various
effects.

column3:
どの戦いでどのエリクシルを用いるかが
戦いの結果にも大きく影響するのだ
column4:
The choice of which Elixirs to use in each battle
greatly affects the outcome of the fight.

column3:
君は《アルケミスト》として学んでいるのだね
調子はどうだい？
術の仕組みが解ってくれば
おのずと慣れてくるだろう
column4:
You are studying as an Alchemist, right?
How are you doing?
Once you understand the mechanism of magic, You
will naturally get used to it.

column3:
――そうだね、ジョブレベル１８と
いったところだろうか
column4: --I'd say job level 18.

column3:
それくらい基礎を修めたなら
次の段階に進んでもいいだろう
column4:
If you have mastered the basics to that extent,
you can proceed to the next stage.

column3:
もっとも、その前に神殿で君の戦いぶりを
日頃見ているであろう者から
本当にアルケミストを続けるべきか
同意はもらっておいた方がいい
column4:
However, it would be wise to obtain the approval
of those who have been observing your battle
prowess at the temple before continuing as an
Alchemist.

column3:
君がアルケミストとしてさらなるものを求め
君の戦いぶりを見ている者も許すのであれば――
その時はわたしが直接手ほどきをしよう
column4:
If you, as an Alchemist, seek something even
greater.
And if those who witness your battles are willing
to forgive—
Then, I shall personally guide you.

column3:
ほほう――
君は白竜がかつて封じた錬金術を
覚者でありながら、究めようというんだね
column4:
Oh, I see— You, as an Arisen, wish to learn the
alchemy that the White Dragon once sealed away.

column3:
嬉しくもあり、危うくもあり――
だが君が選んだのなら
私はその選択を尊重するよ
column4:
With happiness and uncertainty intermingled--
But if that's what you've chosen,
I will respect your decision.

column3:
錬金術とはそもそも、人の論理を用い
人の為に導く学問
理との共存も、君ならできるかもしれないね
column4:
Alchemy is, in the first place, the study of
using human logic to guide people.
You might be able to coexist with reason, too.

column3:
さて、これまで君が学んできたものを基礎とすると
これから私が教えるのは応用編だな
さらに深く論理を知り、属性と物質の
精――エリクシルの本質に迫る
column4:
Well, based on what you have learned so far, what
I will teach you next is the advanced edition.
Delve deeper into logic, the essence of attributes
and materials, the essence of Elixirs.

column3:
その理解と転化、そして組み換えこそが
《アルケミスト》の理
column4:
And thus, understanding, transformation, and
recombination are the true essence of the
Alchemist's order.

column3:
さぁ、さっそく課題を出そう
君がその一端に触れてくれることを願うよ
column4:
Now, let's promptly submit the assignment. I hope
you can lend a hand in that regard.

column3:
ふむ、君のアルケミストとしての研鑽には
目を見張るものがある
十分応用を学べるレベルになっているようだね
column4:
Hmm, your dedication to studying as an Alchemist
is truly remarkable. It seems you have reached a
level where you can learn and apply skills
extensively.

column3:
もしも、君が錬金の道の奥深くへと
歩みを進めようというならば
わたしが直接手ほどきしたいところだが――
そうするべきかどうか、判断が難しい
column4:
If you are willing to take a step deeper into the
path of alchemy, I would love to teach you
directly--
but it's hard to decide if I should.

column3:
神殿で君の訓練や戦いぶりを見てきた者
が賛成するなら、わたしは構わないが
column4:
If those who have witnessed your training and
battles at the temple agree, I have no objections.

column3: なるほど、覚者か――
column4: I see, an Arisen, huh?

column3: 予断を許さない状況のようだね
column4:
It seems like a situation that doesn't allow for
any speculation.

column3:
君のことは気になるが――
余計な詮索は止めにしておこう――互いにね
column4:
I'm curious about you--
but let's not pry too much into each other's
affairs--we're both here for each other.

column3:
生きていればこんな体験ができる
ああ、やはり人生は素晴らしいね
column4:
If you are alive, you can have such experiences,
Ah, indeed life is wonderful.

column3: 過ぎたるは及ばざるがごとし、か
column4: Excessive is as bad as useless.

column3:
なぜ、こうなってしまったのか――
いつか明らかにしてみせよう
ああ、もちろん、楽しみで仕方がないよ
column4:
How did this happen--
I'll reveal it to you one day.
Oh, and of course, I'm looking forward to it!

column3:
あの日――黄金竜と白竜の戦い以来
我々が過ごしてきたこの時間を――
わたしが解き明かしてみせよう
column4:
Since that day - the battle between the Golden
Dragon and hours.
This time we have spent, I will unravel it for
you.

column3:
過ちは、誰にでもある
それを正す勇気こそ、尊いのだ
column4:
Everyone makes mistakes. It is the courage to
correct them that is precious.

column3:
すべてを知りつくしたつもりでも
まだこうして予測不能な出来事が起こる
うれしくもあり――恐ろしくもあり――だね
column4:
Even if you think you know everything, unexpected
events can still happen. It's both exciting and
terrifying, isn't it?

column3: ああ、クラウスの友達か、どうしたんだい？
column4: Ah, Klaus's friend, what's up?

column3:
錬金術師が始めたことは
錬金術師が終わらせる
column4:
What the alchemist started, the alchemist will
finish.

column3: それが我々の覚悟だ
column4: That is our Arisen's resolve.

column3: ディアマンテスは錬金術師の面汚し――
column4: Diamantes is a disgrace to the alchemists.

column3:
奴を倒せる日が来ようとは
ああ、堪え忍んだ甲斐があったというものだ
column4:
I never thought I'd see the day he'd be defeated.
Oh, it's been worth it.

column3:
神殿の連中によろしく伝えてくれ
心の準備ができたら、わたしの方から
挨拶に行きたいと思う
column4:
Please convey my regards to the temple personnel.
Once I am mentally prepared, I would like to go
and greet them.

column3: さあ、今は早く帰った方がいい
column4: Now, it's better to go home quickly.

column3:
ああ、その話だな
いいだろう
column4: Ah, that story, right? That's fine.

column3:
立場上、ひいきするわけにはいかないが
私が最も愛するジョブは当然《ファイター》だ
column4:
On principle, I cannot show favoritism, but my
most beloved job is, of course, "Fighter."

column3:
己が身を敵前にさらし、盾と剣を巧みに操り
それはまるで舞の如く――
column4:
Exposing oneself to the enemy and deftly wielding
shield and sword. It's like a dance—.

column3:
突破口を開いて敵陣深く入り込み
本陣をかく乱する――
ふふ、敵が驚き、呆ける顔を間近で見られるのは
《ファイター》だけだ！
column4:
Opening a breakthrough and infiltrating deep into
enemy territory
Disrupting their main force -
Hehe, being able to see the surprised and
bewildered faces up close
Is something only a Fighter can do!

column3:
おまえもなかなか腕を上げ、《ファイター》と
しての自覚を身に付けつつあるようだな
column4:
You have also been improving quite a bit and seem
to be gaining a sense of being a Fighter.

column3:
――よし、私から修練を課してやろう
そして今以上に技を磨き、一流の剣士となれ！
column4:
Alright, I will impose training upon you And
thus, polish your skills even more, become a
first-class swordsman!

column3:
よし、いいだろう
《ファイター》を名乗ることを許そう
column4:
Okay, fine. I'll allow you to call yourself a
Fighter.

column3:
まぁいい
新たな剣技を教えてやる
column4:
Well, never mind. I will teach you a new sword
technique.

column3:
今以上に強くなりたければ、修練を重ね
さらに技を会得するのだな
column4:
If you want to become stronger than you are now,
train harder and further hone your skills.

column3:
ほう――、かなり腕を上げたようだな
今のおまえなら、あの技も使い
こなせるだろう
column4:
Well, you've really improved your skills, haven't
you?
With your current ability, you should be able to
use that technique and master it.

column3:
剣の役割とは相手を斬ること
だが、それは道具としての役目であって
剣の本質ではない
column4:
The role of a sword is to slash the opponent.
However, that is only its function as a tool.
It is not the essence of a sword.

column3:
敵を削ぎ己を活かす
それこそが本質だ
勝敗、生死は全て、その結果
付いてくるものにすぎない
column4:
Reduce your enemy and make the most of yourself;
That's the essence.
Winning and losing, life and death, are all just
the result of what comes with it.

column3: それを心に留め、この技を修得するがいい
column4:
Remember that in your heart, you should strive to
master this technique.

column3:
知っての通り《ファイター》の武器は剣と盾
そして己自身の肉体だ
column4:
As you know, the weapon of a Fighter is a sword
and a shield and their own body.

column3:
敵を討つ、それがファイターに課された最大の
役割だが、ただ攻撃をすればよいというわけではない
自身を守り、先陣に居続けることが仲間を救い
ひいては勝利につながるのだ
column4:
The greatest role imposed on a Fighter is to
defeat enemies, but it's not simply about
attacking. Protecting oneself and staying at the
forefront can save comrades and ultimately lead to
victory.

column3:
攻守どちらをおろそかにしても、一流のファイター
とは言えないというわけだ
column4:
Regardless of whether you neglect offense or
defense, it means that you cannot be called a
first-class Fighter.

column3:
敵と斬り結ぶ中、技術は後からでも付いてくる
ファイターとなるなら、まずは剣と盾が身体の一部と
思えるようになるまで振るい、感覚をなじませろ
column4:
With cutting with the enemy, the skill comes
later.
If you want to be a fighter, first swing your
sword and shield until you feel like they are part
of your body
and familiarize yourself with them.

column3:
それ以上のことは、おまえが一人前のファイターに
なった頃に教えてやる
column4:
I will teach you more when you become a
full-fledged Fighter.

column3:
盾は、身を守るだけのものではないぞ
使いようによっては敵の攻撃をいなし
反撃の足掛かりとすることもできる
column4:
The shield is not just for self-defense.
Depending on how it is used, it can block the
enemy's attacks and serve as a foothold for
counterattacks.

column3:
攻撃を受ける直前、敵の体重がかかる
わずかな瞬間を見定めろ
column4:
Just before receiving an attack, determine the
moment when the enemy's weight is applied.

column3:
そこを捉えれば反動はそっくり相手に
返り、態勢を崩すことができるだろう
column4:
If you seize that moment, the recoil will be
completely returned to the opponent
, and you will be able to disrupt their stance.

column3:
《クリティカルタイミング》――
ちまたではそんな呼び方をしているらしい
覚えておくことだ
column4:
《Critical Timing》――
It seems that is what they call it.
Remember that.

column3:
ほう――
私に稽古をつけてもらいたいのか？
column4: Oh... Do you want me to teach you a lesson?

column3:
なら少なくとも《ファイター》となり
ジョブレベル１８以上の経験を
積むことだな
column4:
Then, let us send you to the past. Oh, Arisen of
the White Dragon, may fortune favor you.

column3:
その後、訓練官レンテンの許可が
出たなら考えてやろう
話はそれからだ
column4:
After that, I'll think about it if the Training
Officer Renton gives the green light. Then we'll
talk about it.

column3:
あぁ――
私に稽古をつけてもらいたいのか？
なるほど確かに相応の腕になったようだ
column4:
Oh—you want me to train you? Well, you certainly
look like you're up to snuff.

column3:
だが何事にも順序がある
まずは神殿の訓練官レンテンに
ジョブの基本を修めた報告くらいはしてこい
column4:
But there's an order to everything.
First, you should at least report to Lenten, the
temple trainer,
that you've mastered the basics of the job.

column3:
正式に教えを請いにきたならば
稽古に付き合ってやろう
column4:
If you have come to formally seek knowledge,
I shall accompany you in your training.

column3:
戦術を指南してほしいのか？
ならば実戦に勝る教えはないぞ
column4:
You want me to teach you tactics? Then there's no
better way to learn than through combat.

column3:
戦いは勝つためにするのだ
そのための努力、怠るな
column4:
We fight in order to win. Do not neglect the
effort required for that.

column3:
すまないな
世間話というものが苦手なんだ
column4:
I'm sorry,
but I'm not good at small talk

column3:
集中だ！
戦闘態勢は寝所でも解くな！
column4:
Concentration! Don't let your guard down even in
your sleeping quarters!

column3:
覚者とは何か――
いろいろな考えがあるだろうが
自分は、戦人（いくさびと）だと信じている
column4:
What is an Arisen? There may be various thoughts,
but I believe I am a warrior.

column3:
こう戦闘続きでは疲れもたまるな――
キノザでゆっくりしたいものだ
column4:
I'm getting tired after all these battles-- I'd
like to relax in Kinoza.

column3:
魔物より恐ろしい敵の名を教えてやろう
それは――油断、慢心、怠慢だ
column4:
I will teach you the name of an enemy more
frightening than monsters. It is--carelessness,
complacency, and negligence.

column3:
どれほどの敵を倒せば
この地に平穏が訪れるのか――
こんなことを思うとは――老いたか
column4:
How many enemies must I defeat for peace to come
to this land? To think such a thing... have I
grown old?

column3:
勝利の秘策？
そんなものがあるなら、そもそも戦争など起こらない
column4:
The secret strategy for victory? If such a thing
exists, wars wouldn't happen in the first place.

column3:
価値を問う前に、黙って守れ
失って後悔したくなければな
column4:
Before you question the value, shut up and
protect unless you want to lose it and regret it.

column3: 何？　拠点防衛に関する提案？
column4: What? A proposal regarding base defense?

column3:
オークどもをぶっ倒し、追いだしても
臭いはしばらく残るんだ
たまらん――くそっ！
column4:
Even if you knock the orcs off and drive them out
the smell lingers for a while. I can't stand it --
damn it!

column3: 魔物掃除に来たのか？
column4: Did you come to exterminate the enemy?

column3:
だったら遠慮はいらない
砦の外でひと暴れしてきてくれ
column4:
Then you should at least become a 《Fighter》 and
have at least 18 job levels of experience.

column3:
アルヴァーと会ったらしいな
だったら、こんなところにいないで
さっさと契約をすませたらどうだ？
column4:
I heard you met Alvar. If that's the case, why
don't you finish the contract quickly? You
shouldn't be here instead.

column3:
どうした？
レオの話し相手は退屈か？
column4: What's the matter? Bored of talking to Leo?
